page.title: 14Transport
page.content: Transport is very limited on the moor roads. The main road through Ugglebarnby and Fylingdales Moor is the B1416 Whitby to Scarboroigh road which meets up with the A171. There is only one daily bus which serves the people of this area. Littlebeck is not serviced by public transport because of the very steep hills into the village. Most people have their own transport, usually a family type car or van. The most popular type of transport for the farmer is the Land Rover, a vehicle which enables him to drive to the most inaccessible areas of his land. Also farmers have their own tractor or transport wagon for conveying cattle to the market.
